info.game_comments: (Jon: Duty, honor, country: they'll come up in clues from West Point, next on Jeopardy!)

jeopardy_round: THE U.S. MILITARY ACADEMY AT WEST POINT

(1, 1).clue: (Jon of the Clue Crew reports from West Point, NY.)  The name West Point comes from the Academy's location on the west bank of this river about 50 miles north of New York City

(2, 1).clue: One of Ricky's first hits was this song heard here that was also a hit for Fats Domino"I'm lonely as I can be /And I've waited for your company..."

(3, 1).clue: We envy the Egyptian mau cat, whose eyes are the gooseberry shade of this color

(4, 1).clue: It's been known to shed a little light:A/C OR NO

(5, 1).clue: In 1889 this island joined up with Tobago as a single colony

(6, 1).clue: Dismissive insectoid name for an American ethnic group of British non-Catholic ancestry

(1, 2).clue: (Jon of the Clue Crew reports from a field at West Point, NY.)  This West Point grad went on to become a four-star general, & once declared, "It is as natural for me to be a soldier as it is to breathe"

(2, 2).clue: It's the immensely popular TV show on which Ricky appeared from 1952 to 1966

(3, 2).clue: The first Cornish Rex cat was the offspring of a tortie & a white barn cat in this part of SW England

(5, 2).clue: This "wild" guy was hired as the marshal of Abilene in 1871

(6, 2).clue: If you're "on" this, you're angry & in the mood for confrontation

(1, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew is flanked by two students at West Point, NY.)  Freshmen at West Point are shown their place by being known as these, from a Roman term for ordinary, uneducated citizens

(2, 3).clue: Gene Pitney wrote this musical greeting that charted for Ricky in 1961"Passed me by one sunny day /Flashed those big brown eyes my way /And ooh, I wanted you forevermore"

(3, 3).clue: Shulamith, a stray discovered in 1981, was the first American curl cat, named for its perky-looking pair of these

(4, 3).clue: Might be Ben Kenobi's favorite:SIN GENUS

(5, 3).clue: In 1827 Allan Cunningham became the first European to explore this continent's Darling Downs

(1, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reads in front of a set of wooden doors at West Point, NY.)  The United States Military Academy's coat of arms depicts the helmet of this Greek goddess of wisdom & warfare

(2, 4).clue: One of Ricky's identical twin sons who have recorded songs as the pop-rock duo Nelson

(3, 4).clue: A relatively new breed of cat with very short legs bears the name of these little beings introduced in a 1900 book

(5, 4).clue: In the 1870s this U.S. political party was split between the Stalwarts & the Half-Breeds

(1, 5).clue: (Jon of the Clue Crew reports from in front of a military exercise.)  A shortage of blue cloth led to uniforms of a different color & to this 3-word term for the corps of cadets

(2, 5).clue: This song heard here was Rick's last Top 40 hit, in 1972"But it's all right now /I've learned my lesson well /You see, you can't please everyone..."

(3, 5).clue: The Balinese is basically a long-haired version of this other Asian cat

(4, 5).clue: It can be upon Tyne or a fresh palace:NEWT LACES

(5, 5).clue: During this war, the Allies took Sevastopol on September 9, 1855

(6, 5).clue: After NATO admitted West Germany in 1955, the USSR & its satellites met & formed this

(2, 1).clue: Of insects, beets or berries, the one that's the original source of red cochineal dye used to color British uniforms

(3, 1).clue: Add a "G" to make a prominent member of the wedding into a prominent transportation structure

(4, 1).clue: The first section of this 1958 Leon Uris novel is titled "Beyond Jordan"

(5, 1).clue: Pop hit P.T.A. site for Jeannie C. Riley

(6, 1).clue: This "pack" of fashionable dolls now includes Rock Angelz, who have their own guitars (or should that be guitarz?)

(2, 2).clue: Chelia and Toubkal are 2 of the peaks in this mountain chain of North Africa

(3, 2).clue: An "E" transforms your puppy into the chief magistrate in the former Republic of Genoa

(4, 2).clue: The influential theologian Elaine Pagels has published "Beyond Belief: The Secret Gospel of" this doubting Apostle

(5, 2).clue: At 282 feet below sea level, a spot in this valley is the lowest point in the Western Hemisphere

(6, 2).clue: Kirsten, one the American Girl dolls, is a pioneer who immigrated to Minnesota from this country

(2, 3).clue: In the Scarecrow's song "If I Only Had a Brain" from "The Wizard of Oz", this U.S. president is mentioned

(3, 3).clue: Without an "S", it's royal rule; with an "S", it means to quit

(4, 3).clue: His "Giant" memoir is titled "Over the Edge: Tackling Quarterbacks, Drugs, and a World Beyond Football"

(5, 3).clue: You'll find Queen Hatshepsut's tomb in this valley

(2, 4).clue: He was on the cover of the February 11, 1957 Time magazine with the headline "Brains v. Dollars on T.V."

(3, 4).clue: Luminous brightness degenerates into loud, empty protests when "B" gets in front

(4, 4).clue: This American playwright won 4 Pulitzer Prizes for Drama, including one for 1920's "Beyond the Horizon"

(5, 4).clue: The monolith known as "El Capitan" towers over 3,500 feet above this valley

(2, 5).clue: This poet died with Edward Elliker Williams after his ship capsized during an 1822 storm

(3, 5).clue: On adding an "R", a word meaning "stop" starts meaning a ridge made by folding

(4, 5).clue: "Beyond Giving" by this British author of "I, Claudius" contains a poetic tribute to those killed in WWI

(5, 5).clue: Valley near Dusseldorf famous for its human fossils

(0, 0).clue: In the 20th century, 2 of the 3 men who served less than 1 year as VP before becoming president
